instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .

threads.title: 3462 no battery
threads.message:
everything looks good on the board, no liquid no damage.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.  does not dectect battery, when you unplug magsafe turns off.  tried with new battery same results

threads.title: 3462 no battery
threads.message: its okay. i found out the problem pbus is slightly off. that lead me to checking <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> pin 2 being short. smc and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> need to be replaced no?

threads.title: 3462 no battery
threads.message:
You have a problem on battery bus.
No more than 1% difference between SCL/SDA is allowed; more likely less than 0.5%.
First remove <DIODE>D6950</DIODE>.
If still bad, remove <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and check again diode mode to ground.
Remember, do NOT power up the board until find the culprit.
Last option, if still SDA short to ground, pull out SMC.
Be sure the short is gone and solder other SMC, from donor board...

threads.title: 3462 no battery
threads.message:
<DIODE>D6950</DIODE> - removed still short
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP> - removed still short
smc - removed short gone

will replace all
